references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the ResNet architecture, which is the backbone model used in the current study.

references.paper_title: Shortcut learning in deep neural networks
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it discusses shortcut learning, a phenomenon the current study investigates and contextualizes.

references.paper_title: Implicit regularization in deep matrix factorization
references.reason: This paper is cited for its discussion of implicit regularization in deep learning models, which is closely tied to the concepts of simplicity bias and model preferences explored in the study.

references.paper_title: The origins and prevalence of texture bias in convolutional neural networks
references.reason: This paper is central to the current study as it focuses on feature preferences in CNNs, a topic directly addressed in the study.

references.paper_title: A theory of usable information under computational constraints
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of V-information, which is the theoretical foundation of the complexity metric developed in the study.
